description: The first cyber sigilism tattoo I ever did, this one is a wrap around from the shoulder down to the wrist.
A funny little tattoo of a black cat from my flash sheet inspired by 'cursed cat' memes.
The perfect tattoo for this bookworm client, he sent me a couple of his favourite book titles to incorporate as well.
From one of my favourite flash sheets, this is my take on the temperance tarot card.
Inspired by space couch, but it's really just a regular couch
This forearm piece is one of many japanese-style inspired tattoos apart of a patchwork sleeve.
A tough spot for a first tattoo, this client went for a piece to show their passion for boxing.
My take on the cyber sigilism style, mixed with the client's request to incorporate a feminine figure.
Can't go wrong with a classic Doberman tattoo, so this client requested it as a cover-up.
I absolutely love these eyes that drip into eachother. This piece was claimed almost instantly when I posted my first abstract flash page
A plastic daisy in flames inspired by a song from my favourite band, this tattoo depicts Avenged Sevenfold's 'Mattel'
My first, more traditional, japanese-style koi fish tattoo.
Gorgeous shoulder-collarbone floral as this client's first tattoo!
More from the japanese sleeve, here is some cherry blossom filler and a fan.
This cute frog on a mushroom house is one of my original nature flash designs
Just decorating the hand with some cute, dainty finger tattoos and a quote.
This client simply came to me with an idea, and by just listening to them I was able to create the exact tattoo he had envisioned.
A classic knife customized with the eyes of a favourite anime character
With two pretty koi fish dancing, this bicep tattoo was made to fit perfectly while doubling as a cover-up.
This is my take on a Medusa tattoo, put into a tarot card as requested by the client.
This sentimental pet tattoo is the pawprint of a beloved family dog who passed away.
A client's custom requests for a skull smoking a joint while wearing a top hat.
This client told me in his past life he was a templar, so we decided to put a templar sword on his arm with his initials in the handle.
Wearing your heart on your sleeve looks a little different when it is red and black and made out of waves.
These grunge fairy wings are the first big back piece I have done.
